intro: Escobaria roseana subsp. galeanensis, commonly known as the Galean’s liveforever, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit with fleshy, ribbed stems. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are usually reduced to spines, and it is adapted to arid environments with minimal water requirements. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils.
